website_summaries.verdict: While it comes in handy under some conditions and is easy to use, this plant cover may not live up to expectations during serious frosts or freezes.
pros: Suitable for shrubs and small trees
Easy to put on and take off
cons: Not very effective for extreme freezes or colder temperatures

customer_reviews.title: The product would be better if directions and protection level were printed on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Paid for two day shipping, USPS delivered it in three days. Applied the covers and it was as if I put nothing on my plants. I read nothing about how low a temperature they would protect so probably worthless for 29 degrees, which is how low the temp went here. We had three nights of frost and two nights of 29 degrees. All my plants were severely damaged, including citrus. Next time I'll cover with something substantial. The product would be better if directions and protection level were printed on the product packaging. A waste of money in my case.
customer_reviews.author: billavet

customer_reviews.title: Did absolutely nothing to protect our trees
customer_reviews.text: This product claims to protect plants from snow hail, and frost in the winter. We live in Texas and spent hours covering our palm trees with this product and it did absolutely nothing! Our trees were beautifully green before and after just two hours of freezing temps, they have brown tips. We were counting on this product to protect our fairly new landscaping and it definitely didn’t meet our expectations or their claims.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Product - It Will Protect Your Plant(s).
customer_reviews.text: I have a Hibiscus plant in a large planter. We had a cold winter in Alabama. I had been covering the Hibiscus with a sheet. The sheet was too heavy and damaged limbs on the plant. I ordered the Agfabric Warm Frost Blanket. The day after I got it we had several nights below freezing. The Frost Blanket was very easy to put on my Hibiscus. I am impressed with the draw string that can be tightened around the trunk of the plant. I have to say I was amazed how effective the Frost Blanket was during five days of freezing weather. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Smiley42

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work that well to prevent frost damage
customer_reviews.text: We live in NY and get cold snowy winters. I’ve noticed that the flowers from the camellia bush always bloom with frost damage so decided to see if these covers will work. Even after building a scaffolding around the bush to prevent the frost from going through the cover, the flowers were still frost damaged. We probably need thicker covers and will try something else this winter. Was hoping the thin covers will work so sun can go through and we don’t have to take on and off the whole winter.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Really works to protect Tropical plants
customer_reviews.text: So I use this to cover a 6' mango tree to protect from damage that did a number on tree last year. This cover was installed at the same time as I made some other (smaller) covers from the fabric weed barrier. In the most recent frost the Agfabric covered tree was the only one not to sustain any damage. I was surprised given how thin it is compared to the thicker more opaque barrier bags I made, but they did not provide the level of protection that the Agfabric bad did. I am a believer. Would buy again to protect any younger or sensitive tropical type trees. The work.
customer_reviews.author: Chango Pelon

customer_reviews.title: Returned it. I covered my tree prior to the ...
customer_reviews.text: Returned it. I covered my tree prior to the last frost and the tree was affected by the cold. Dead in several places. It is NOT frost free. Save your money as this product does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Truth

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Cover for Large Plants
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to protect a very large (8'+) hibiscus from the occasional freeze in Houston. I did a test fit tonight when the cover arrived and ordered 3 more of various sizes to protect other large tropicals in my landscape. We don't hit subfreezing temps often or for very long here, but sometimes, one night is all it takes to kill tender vegetation. This lightweight but sturdy cover is perfect for larger plants need a few degrees of protection that won't crush them!
customer_reviews.author: Shark Girl

customer_reviews.title: Too thin, not durable. 1x use.
customer_reviews.text: Put it on a young fruit tree for an early September, multi-night freeze we experienced here in Colorado. It got shredded on the tree branches very quickly due to the wind that came in with the cold front. Just missed my return window, unfortunately. I purchase many of these thinking we could reuse them throughout multiple years in the spring to protect all of our fruit trees, but it seems these will be good for a 1x use. Bummed because these are NOT cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent frost protection
customer_reviews.text: We were skeptical when we bought this since we've had so many failures with such plant covers, but this has worked wonders. We just took them down and see that 85% of the leaves (flowers and fruit trees) are intact. There were lots of chilly mornings and it's done an awesome job
customer_reviews.author: Harish

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely do not buy these. I followed the directions exactly as stated, and in a Georgia winter these did not work. As you can see from the picture it did not protect my cactus that I had for over 15 years. It was too big to move inside and I mistakenly tried these. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: MamaTree

customer_reviews.title: These work really well. Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: These work really well. We bought 4 and all made it through winter with flying colors. We kept taking them off thinking no more freeze, so in 1 southern winter, they actually got a lot of use and held up well. The only thing is that for some of our bushes, the winds were pretty strong, and we had to put a rock on the base, even after using the draw string, to keep them from flying off. The good news is that all of our more delicate plants survived this year, including our new in ground fruit tree & potted lemon, both of which started to blossom. Yea!
customer_reviews.author: laura werner

customer_reviews.title: Large enough for a small tree
customer_reviews.text: I bought this frost blanket for my Satsuma Tree. I was taking a risk by planting the tree in my 8a zone, but hope with this blanket to survive our winters. The tree is about 7 ft high and 6 ft wide and the blanket fits easily over the whole tree and touches the ground. So far my tree does well with nights around 28 degree, if it gets any colder I get some Christmas lights to warm it up a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Phh

customer_reviews.title: Size and fabric seem to be working great. Easy
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be working fine. Easy to remove and placement was simple. So far the lemon tree has gone through 30 degrees but not advisable to use if the temps are below that. I have also place a light on the tree underneath the cover. The cover itself is made well and the fabric seems to be holding up just fine. Hope my lemon tree gets through this winter outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: debugnlily

customer_reviews.title: Trying this to see if I can grow citrus outdoors in zone 8a
customer_reviews.text: The fabric is very sturdy (notice these are sold in different fabric weights). I bought this to cover a Meyer Lemon tree I planted in the ground this (after rolling it in and out of my garage for the two previous winters). My hope is that by using the frost blanket and C7 Christmas lights that I can keep it alive outdoors in zone 8a.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Comfort

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use & sturdy  covers for larger plants or bushes.
customer_reviews.text: Just put 2 of 3 covers on my camellias as cold weather is setting in. The covers seem sturdy & were easy to handle - 2 people would make it super easy but I was able to put the covers on by myself. One camellia is about 6 ft high but is well covered. The 2nd is about 5 ft high but quite full & is also well covered. Hopefully the covers will be sturdy enough for the winter. I'll be using the 3rd cover when my fall camellia finishes blooming. I can't comment on the durability as I just started using them.
customer_reviews.author: george r

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy! Strong chemical smell!
customer_reviews.text: Large enough to cover 2 Basil plants in 14" pots and did add protection over another cover (which had to use ... see below). But this stunk!!! Chemicals?!!! The protecting cloth (large sheet to cut into sizes) that I purchased from Gardaner did not smell at all (gave that an excellent review). Had to air this one out. And put a layer of the Gardaner sheet between this one and the basils. Didn't wanting it touching them! Yes, helped to have the extra layer, but I don't recommend. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Janis Levy

customer_reviews.title: Not good for Frost Protection
customer_reviews.text: I liked this product because of its large size and also the drawstring feature that allows you to close the cover tightly at the bottom of the plant or the pot. I think this would be good to prevent bugs and animals from infesting or eating plants. This is NOT a good choice for Frost protection. I live in zone 8, I monitored the weather and paid attention to reports of Freeze/Frost warnings. This product does not protect against frost, after the first frost my plants were done for. Next year I will find a product that has more weight and more protective properties.
customer_reviews.author: KarenSu

customer_reviews.title: ... in the 30's which is a problem for tropicals like philodendron plants
customer_reviews.text: Here in central Florida our winter weather can range from 80 and down to the lows in the 30's which is a problem for tropicals like philodendron plants. Use to run out on a cold night with a plant fabric sheet and try holding it down with rocks, pavers, anything heavy I could find. Now I just go out there with this "bag", slip it over and pull the drawstring. No need to anchor with weights unless it's extremely windy. Great product and my philodendron is looking good after a couple of nights in the mid-30's.
customer_reviews.author: bakernana

customer_reviews.title: While the quality of the cover seems fine, the manufacturer could have used a better cord ...
customer_reviews.text: I just used this plant cover (72" X 72") to protect my fig tree for the winter season here in suburban North Jersey. While the quality of the cover seems fine, the manufacturer could have used a better cord lock to cinch the bottom of the cover - but, that is a minor detraction. I did top off the cover with a tarp as I do not want too much water flowing through it. Plus, any snow buildup will easily slide off, especially when the sun shines upon the tarp.
customer_reviews.author: Chef Jerry R.

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional quality, easy to use, effective
customer_reviews.text: In Texas we have a dozen or so freezing temperatures each year and if you've worked to bring your trees, plants, scrubs, greenery along & am hoping to build on it beginning in the spring, the Agfabric Plant Cover Warm Worth Frost Blanket is the way to go. Inexpensive compared to Lowes, Home Depot and especially local garden centers, these plant covers will last you for many seasons to come.
customer_reviews.author: Manbyk

customer_reviews.title: Pictures say it all
customer_reviews.text: I spent over $300.00 on these bags and blankets and after 4 days of 22 degrees all my plants are dead! the description says good to 4 degrees. What a joke! I have contacted the shipper and they have not offered any restitution. I'm not giving up. I am going for Agrifab next. Some of my plants were over 5 years old and they were just too big and heavy to put in the greenhouse. Very sad!
customer_reviews.author: amazoncrazy

customer_reviews.title: This protected my blueberry bush perfectly for the whole Japanese beetle season!
customer_reviews.text: This cover is super easy to use and is made of a good quality material. I'm very happy with it and intend to buy more for my other bushes. I'm trying to find ways to protect my plants from the awful damage that the beetles cause. This works very well and is reasonable priced.
customer_reviews.author: DianaWI

customer_reviews.title: Disappointingly thin
customer_reviews.text: The size was more than I needed but better too much than not enough. It has a seemingly flimsy toggle for the cord but it turned out to be quite stout. What is disappointing is the fabric itself. Fairly light weight Tyvek type fabric. I would probably kept the plants warmer with some cheap plastic drop cloths. Okay but I can't recommend them for much real use.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon M. Pyron

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I bought four of these and after a month they are just disintegrating. Of course the return window has closed however I am going to pursue this with the vendor and Amazon. I feel I should be refunded. The product does not say, 'Good for about a month'. I'll post an update if I get any satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Mick B.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This oversize shrub cover worked great in overwintering my tropical hibiscus in Long Island New York (Zone 7). Its easy to cover the entire plant and keep the tightly wrapped at the base with a simple pull of its draw string
customer_reviews.author: Teck Kang Pang

customer_reviews.title: Plants are Safe and Sound
customer_reviews.text: This fabric cover was bigger than I expected. I am just using it to cover a pot like the picture shows, but I think this could easily cover a small bush. This definitely serves it's purpose and functions the way it should. I've been using it to cover my strawberry plants when the temperature drops below 30 degrees. I haven't had any issues yet, so it must be working! It's also reusable which is a big win for me. I'm really glad I found this!
customer_reviews.author: jackie

customer_reviews.title: This is a great plant and tree cover
customer_reviews.text: This is a great plant and tree cover. I have 2 plants/tree under it and it is doing a wonderful job. I love the pull cord at the bottom. On windy days, I can pull it tight so the cover stays in place.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent protection.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to protect my Orange Tea Olive tree that I planted last October. I live in Maryland so this tree is not guaranteed to survive our winter temperatures. I bought this blanket to protect it from the winter frost and so far so good, with it being April 10th, I can see new buds coming off the branches. No tears or rips with the winter winds that we had so this did a very good job.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Good during winters that have wide temperature ranges
customer_reviews.text: We had another colder than normal winter, but this time my garden is came through without frost damage. The fabric breathes well enough that it doesn't need to be removed during the heat spikes we get in Tidewater Virginia.
customer_reviews.author: Questor

customer_reviews.title: Works well to protect plants over winter
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these to place over several newly planted trees to protect them from cold this winter and they seem to work well. The trees survived without any damage. It would be nice if they were a bit taller, however. There is plenty of room width-wise, but taller would also be nice to accommodate taller plants.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Good fabric; Product needs some QC
customer_reviews.text: I think these covers are great except they stitched the drawstring to the bag so they could not be drawn up easily around the base of the plant. This occurred on 3 of 5 purchased. I write this before the upcoming cold front where we are expecting almost gale force winds. I'll update if they do NOT work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Biediger

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I wish these covers had something in the corners to keep them erect. I hate that the tops of my arbovitaes are bend over, especially in even light snow. I hope they're not getting weak at the tops. I place the tops in the corners, which helps, but with the wind, they don't stay in place. It's frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: MsOnlineShopper

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: We used these for covering our tall sweet bay shrubs. Looks like this winter our sweet bay will survive and we won't have to replace any of them. The bag allows sunlight during the day and helps prevent freeze damage to the plants.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Great Frost Protection
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and versatile plant covers -- these have saved my Meyer Lemon trees from those below-freezing nights. These covers allow air and light to reach the tree but provide an invaluable insulation from frost.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Convenient--hopefully we will get figs next year
customer_reviews.text: We live in Zone 6a and wanted our fig trees to live so we got these. I like the draw string because you can make it fit on your tree easily. They come in several sizes so measure your bush or tree.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Effective Bag
customer_reviews.text: The bag appears to keep ice off of the tree but the material torn some putting it on (maybe my fault). The one thing that left a poor impression with me was the draw string. It doesn’t have stoppers or knots to keep the string in the clasp and the clasp doesn’t seem very robust.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Augustine Schmit

customer_reviews.title: Needs a larger opening.
customer_reviews.text: The bag was definitely tall enough for our small lemon tree, but the base could’ve had a larger opening to slip over the branches and trunk. Would’ve been much easier to handle and place over the tree.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Scott

customer_reviews.title: So far so good ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to cover a miniature orange tree that I moved from Southern California to Oregon. It has been three months and so far it has worked very well, including for the few days that we have dropped below freezing this year. I'll write again in March and let you know whether the tree made it! :)
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten T.

customer_reviews.title: These cover work great. We had out citrus trees covered all winter ...
customer_reviews.text: These cover work great. We had out citrus trees covered all winter with them and pulled them off to find oranges!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Wrong product for me!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product thinking it would help me cover my dwarf apple tree. The tree is quite large now so the cover was very difficult to draw the drawstring at the bottom close to the trunk. I had hoped it would help keep the apple maggots and coddling moths from getting into my apples. With the bottom of the cover still fairly open, I doubt this will help. I won't know for sure until I harvest the apples but I'm not very confident that the fruit is protected.
customer_reviews.author: SM Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: FOREST Protection. No thanks, I wanted FROST protection.
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase these. I purchased two of them to protect my potted shrubs in an upcoming freeze. When they arrived, they do not match the picture or the description listed here. They are very lightweight and do not appear to offer any protection from the cold. As you can see in my picture cold weather is nowhere in the description. It does list forest protection as one of its attributes. Well I certainly don't have a whole forest to protect...just two shrubs. Do yourself a favor and purchase these locally so you know what you are getting.
customer_reviews.author: Staci

customer_reviews.title: pretty sturdy
customer_reviews.text: These are heavier than I expected, but I doubt they would protect under 25 degrees. In Houston area they work well for light freezes. They seem sturdy enough that they won't rip apart easily.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Draw string makes product useless.
customer_reviews.text: Fabric is great but the draw string unraveled completely on the first use. It is so badly unraveled that the product is useless. Do not buy ! I took a photo showing how it turned in a pile of knots. If your patient, you could thread a new para cord, but why take the time and effort?
customer_reviews.author: markspark

customer_reviews.title: Nice cover, difficult to use on thorny plants.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cover, only true drawback was putting it on my bougainvillea was VERY difficult because she has spikes, so the cover kept getting caught on those. Otherwise, appears to work well, will see when I remove in the spring.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: They are easy to use and you can leave them on if ...
customer_reviews.text: Worth it. Planning on buying more. They are easy to use and you can leave them on if it warms upf for a day and then temps will be dropping again.
customer_reviews.author: Labrown03

customer_reviews.title: Saved hydrangeas
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t lose blooms on 7 hydrangeas in yard this year. Hope they last several years (no obvious signs of wear after 4 months of fall/winter this past year
customer_reviews.author: D. Randall

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the old bedsheets that I was using!
customer_reviews.text: I love that you don't have to fuss with taking these off each morning and putting them back on in the evening during frosty times. The cover is roomy enough to easily get it over the tree, and the drawstring keeps it in place even when it's windy. They feel sturdy, and I expect that they will last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Miki B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have used these a few times when we received a freeze. So far my plants are still alive. Easy to use and easy to take off, much easier than using old sheets and not as heavy on the plant. Really happy I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: tk82805

customer_reviews.title: SO FAR, SO GOOD
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to cover a Gerbera daisy. So far it has worked during a frost. I'm not sure if it will work in a couple of months when the temperature hits zero. Only thing wrong is that I bought the smallest size, but it was still too big. No problem though. I tucked the ends under the urn. I'll have too update this review later after it gets really cold.
customer_reviews.author: formersec

customer_reviews.title: This frost blanket works!
customer_reviews.text: I covered my perennials to protect them against the once or twice a year we get freezing temps in north Texas. It works like it is supposed to and is lightweight so my plants don't get damaged. I bought the bags that are used for trees, and cut them into rectangles that are easy to handle. Next time I will buy sheets of agfabric.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Swan

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: protects my trees from freeze and size is perfect for dwarf trees
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: so easy and storm tested
customer_reviews.text: Using as protection for our potted tomato plants. Slip it on and we were done. Had a rough rain and wind storm first night we used it, trees down but the Agfabric cover was still in place the next morning. very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hall

customer_reviews.title: This was just the right size for my rose bush ...
customer_reviews.text: This was just the right size for my rose bush and it kept the leaves from dying during our unusual December snow fall in Austin. It wasn't difficult to get over the bush with two people working together.
customer_reviews.author: W. J. Wells

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, not able to withstand strong winds.
customer_reviews.text: Did not hold up to harsh weather conditions, I would not buy again. Strong winds ripped the cord and lining it sits in. I had to improvise with rope to keep it secured to bush. Unacceptable!
customer_reviews.author: Alan H. Loosararian

customer_reviews.title: An easy way to protect a valuable tree!
customer_reviews.text: I had to move the other plants into the garage for overwintering, but not my gorgeous (and heavy) little tree. My husband said it looks like a Halloween ghost. Too bad I waited solong . . .
customer_reviews.author: M'ette

customer_reviews.title: Well made.
customer_reviews.text: I like this product better than the dark fabric covers for mild frost protection since a little light filters through. However, I live in a mild climate...dark might be better in cold climates.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth D. Rivera

customer_reviews.title: SAVE YOUR PLANTS FROM FREEZING!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to cover our Plumeria trees and Hibiscus bushes. They worked beautifully. They were nice and roomy and you can tie them tight on the bottom so the don't blow off.The material is a really nice breathable fabric. I would definately recommend these..
customer_reviews.author: Linda Gallo

customer_reviews.title: Works for light frost and occasionally hard freeze
customer_reviews.text: Worked for my plants. What you need to know is that it won't protect anything in a hard freeze particularly the one that lasted several days. In that case you will need to bring your plants inside, or put an extra blanket on top of it (be sure to cover fully top to bottom), or put a 60W lightbulb at the base of a big plant up to 6 - 8 ft. These frost fabric works perfectly for occasional frost ~ 32 degrees C. All of my tropical plants have already survived though the past 3 winters.
customer_reviews.author: Blackglock27

customer_reviews.title: Begonia survival gear.
customer_reviews.text: Oooh, my miracle begonia is now so cozy and warm...love it! For some reason my huge hanging begonia plant has survived cold, wind, and frost - and I want it to live until spring and, hopefully, re-bloom. This nice blanket slipped right over it, just like in the picture, and my hopes are high! I got it quickly, too. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Claudia G. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for 30 degree F weather
customer_reviews.text: Used these blankets on two small trees during a short freeze (28-30degrees F) in Dallas. Took them off after a few days and the trees were soggy and dead.
customer_reviews.author: JJN

customer_reviews.title: 45 year old plant destroyed due too the companies misleading product description 😢😢
customer_reviews.text: A picture is worth a thousand words😞. I received this split leaf philodendron 45 years ago for the death of my Mom. It’s moved many times and meant more to me than words can say. I trusted your description and believed it would protect my invaluable plant since we only live in Georgia Now it’s past the deadline and can’t even return your defective product I only checked 1 Star since I couldn’t submit unless I did! Extremely heartbroken Barbi Campbell. Bjcampbell48@gmail.com
customer_reviews.author: Barbi C.

customer_reviews.title: Protection for plants during the winter time.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product last year To cover my 2 fig trees during the winter time in the northeast. Both plants survived. I love the product, it works, it protects the plants during the winter time.
customer_reviews.author: concerned aunt

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if this product would work in cold weather for winter. I doubt it. I'm not going to take the risk on losing my plants. I returned this product.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my beautiful rose tree and, although it's a little big, I'm sure it will do the trick for winter. I just used bungees along the trunk to keep the wind from blowing it off. We'll see how it fares through a northern winter.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Very thin material, i Guess it would work for ...
customer_reviews.text: Very thin material, i Guess it would work for a frost but not for this latest freeze that came up the east coast. The plants i covered with this product froze. Savannah GA.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very thin material, i Guess it would work for ...
customer_reviews.text: Very thin material, i Guess it would work for a frost but not for this latest freeze that came up the east coast. The plants i covered with this product froze. Savannah GA.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Effective frost protection
customer_reviews.text: These are more of the same that I already have. Fabric is heavier than most, which means better frost protection. Bags are far easier to use than long lengths of fabric. Tip: If especially cold, wrap plant with lightweight frost fabric then apply these bags.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Great Protection!
customer_reviews.text: We are very pleased with the way these coverings protect out plants and fruit trees from the cold.
customer_reviews.author: KT - unipeg

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy these if you live in a world where there’s any wind
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, these were junk and a total waste of money. We ordered five from this company to cover ornamental trees— 4 were shredded beyond use two days after I put them up (after a wind of about 25 miles an hour max). Unless you’re installing these in a wind protected or wind free environment, I would not buy these. Total waste of money I had to throw them away
customer_reviews.author: Joe W.

customer_reviews.title: awesome cover
customer_reviews.text: For small porch plants and small trees. Takes two people for the larger size but it stays on even in windy conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Chris L.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty flimsy
customer_reviews.text: for the price I was really disappointed in the quality... tore the very first time I used it. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Stanford

customer_reviews.title: Fit well but did not stop the frostbite of my ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit well but did not stop the frostbite of my plants in early to mid Nov where it was touching the fabric so have had to trim off those leaves/branches where fabric was touching because those leaves got zapped. Have since moved my plants inside to try to salvage what's left. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Snell

customer_reviews.title: tears easily. My hearty olive tree made it through the ...
customer_reviews.text: Too thin. tears easily. My hearty olive tree made it through the North Texas freeze, but mt not-so-hearty citrus tree did not, where all of the leaves and some of the branches browned and died.
customer_reviews.author: Mdtracy

customer_reviews.title: 2 thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. My plants are thriving. I take the cover off on warm days. It does exactly as the description says
customer_reviews.author: akorngiebel

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My olive plant survived the winter with this cover. It allowed ventilation and protection.
customer_reviews.author: adjuwaj

customer_reviews.title: Best plant covers
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome covers for plants. Well priced and well made...very easy to cover plants with a handy draw string that keeps them in place even with strong winds.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl Basford

customer_reviews.title: Saved my plants. Yay
customer_reviews.text: Saved my plants from frost. Very grateful for this cover. I use to just use old blankets. This is soooo much better.
customer_reviews.author: CrazyCakes

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to use and a cinch to store away! I would totally buy again. And our plants have been beautifully preserved through the winter days.
customer_reviews.author: Joel B.

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately this did not work for me.
customer_reviews.text: This did not work for me. My Meyer Lemon tree died even though I used this cover. The neighbor next door used some kind of green one...heavier and his tree lived. We planted at the same time so the tree had the same maturity level. I am sad.
customer_reviews.author: Nana T

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy to use. Good sizing.
customer_reviews.text: Used several times to protect my plants from frost and they worked well. Easy to put on and take off and didn’t tear.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Berkowitz

customer_reviews.title: UNEXPECTED
customer_reviews.text: Material is lightweight, covers nicely, and so far so good. I have had to use them on a couple of occasions when our weather has gotten below 28. Fold and store easily (much easier than unpacking and assembling a portable hot house). I did contact the manufacturer and their recommendation was to use either the fabric or lights (not both at the same time)
customer_reviews.author: CABIN

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my parents plants to use during this winter. Works very well and kept the outside plants alive during very cold temps (no snow). Fabric is breathable and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Check the seams of these bags....
customer_reviews.text: I used it to protect some young trees in a cold winter blast of winds. The temp only reached freezing for three hours. The bags tore at the seams. I lost all three trees. Too upset to ask for refund, I'm using the fabric of those bags to line my raised garden beds.
customer_reviews.author: Cabijrose

customer_reviews.title: Won’t protect against a Zone 9 Winter!
customer_reviews.text: I had three healthy 4’ fig trees covered with these frost protection bags with an additional canvas tarp over one mild Long Island winter and all three died. Very disappointed, DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY IF YOU LIVE IN ZONE 9! I should have just wrapped with the traditional method of layers of burlap and tied with string.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Lombardi

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Huge, was too huge for my plant had to send it back but seemed like it was made of great quality
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Easily tear
customer_reviews.text: The 0.95 ounce fabric tears very easily, and the sizes run small. They are not suitable for cold climates (zone 5 or lower), depending on your plant. Hybrid tea roses and, in my case, a southern magnolia (in Maine) need more protection. Trying the 1.5 ounce fabric (maybe two), which is much more substantial as the magnolia is too large for burlap which I normally use for a wrap.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis A. Burnside

customer_reviews.title: Feel ready for winters now.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband to cover and protect his mango trees during the cold weather. Fortunately it didn't get cold enough that he had to use them. Feel good knowing we have them for future winters.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Check size carefully before ordering
customer_reviews.text: Much, much bigger than I thought it would be. Would be fine over large bush. Too much for potted plant
customer_reviews.author: K & C

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my lemon tree protected through 35+ mph winds!
customer_reviews.text: Protecting my lemon tree this winter through these cold winter desert nights. Easy to put on and secure from these high winds we tend to get. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy use
customer_reviews.text: My pygmy palms still got frosted and turned brown these did not seem to help
customer_reviews.author: Pam london

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: They work perfectly. A must have for potted plants and gardening in Colorado.
customer_reviews.author: JumpingJackDog

customer_reviews.title: Not quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use but the string you pull to close at bottom broke on one of them. The covers are very thin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money for frost protection
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work. Was supposed to protect against frost and it didn’t. I lost over $200 worth of vegetation because I took the product at face value. A major live and learn moment.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: excellent plant protection
customer_reviews.text: Well made, a quality product. Useful to keep plants from freezing.
customer_reviews.author: Carole L. Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Order the stakes to secure the fabric to the ground so it doesn’t blow away
customer_reviews.text: This worked great to cover a flower bed of perennials I have beside the house. Lightweight enough not to damage the plants, yet still protect them from freezing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I have used the covers twice now and they are easy to put on and remove. We have not had a hard freeze but did fine when we had freeze warnings.
customer_reviews.author: Deb in Ohio

customer_reviews.title: It does what it suppose to do
customer_reviews.text: It's great for my bush. Just couldnt understand why there was a hole at each end.
customer_reviews.author: Elisa Smith

customer_reviews.title: Cold weather plant preservation.
customer_reviews.text: Great plant cover for cold weather, works really well. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Lastie

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Needed these for a sudden winter chill. Worked perfectly, plants protected
customer_reviews.author: TBlue

customer_reviews.title: This little baby has saved my star jasmine after the ...
customer_reviews.text: This little baby has saved my star jasmine after the below average winter we had in the deep south last year.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

product_meta.title: Agfabric Warm Worth Frost Blanket - 84"x 72" Shrub Jacket, Rectangle White Plant Cover for Season Extension & Frost Protection
feature_bullets: SUITABLE SIZE Perfect for Plant size 80''-84"high and 140''-144" round, Heavy-weight FRCs (0.95 oz./sq. yard): Are usually used to extend the growing season in spring and fall, allow 30%-50% light transmittance, and recommend 3°-8°F. of frost protection.
DRAWSTRING DESIGN Easy drawstring at the openning makes it easier and quicker to cover plants during harsh weather.
BREATHABILITY High quality UV stabilized spun polypropylene fabric allows air and moisture to reach your plants.
LIGHTWEIGHT and soft fabric is plant friendly, no harm to plant growing
APPLICATION Protect plants from snow hail,frost in the winter and insects,birds during the growing season,No need to remove each morning and replace each evening.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars464 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
